alert.note: Alert for Big Horn; Carbon; Carter; Custer; Fallon; Golden Valley; Musselshell; Park; Powder River; Rosebud; Stillwater; Sweet Grass; Treasure; Wheatland; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued May 31 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...Runoff has begun, with significant rises on area streams... Area streams have risen the last day or two from significant precipitation that occurred last weekend. This included two to four inches of precipitation in the foothills, and one to three feet of heavy wet snowfall in the higher elevations of the mountains. The newer snow may be ripe to quickly melt off with warmer temperatures the next few days. In addition, there may still be a lag in streams responding to the recent rainfall in the foothills. Thus, we could still see rising water levels again this week along area creeks and streams. While flooding is not anticipated on larger rivers and streams, there is a chance that some smaller streams and creeks could run high and experience significant erosion impacts. For those living near waterways, be prepared for higher water levels. Move any livestock and equipment to higher ground away from waterways. For those planning recreation activities on or near waterways, be prepared for high flows and fast flowing muddy water. There will be a heightened risk of erosion which can make stream banks unstable. Be sure to stay well away from the edge as undercut stream banks can give way suddenly. Do not allow children to play near the edge of fast flowing streams. Every year children are accidentally swept away during runoff season, don`t let it happen to your children.
